page.title: 20COLEMAN'S HATCH CHURCH
page.content: The parish of Coleman's Hatch is a scattered one with many houses tucked away on the Ashdown Forest. The Church itself is situated on the northern edge of the parish. The parish was formed out of the parish of Hartfield in 1913 and the church consecrated in the November of that year. Although the parishes still remain separate, the benifices were united in March 1978, and the Rector Canon Peter Blake became Vicar of the parish as well as Rector of Hartfield. The church clock strikes every quarter. It also has a peel of 8 bells which are rung regularly and are very popular with visiting bell ringers. The vicarage room in the Church contains an unusual commemerative board recording with thanksgiving those returning safely from the war.
